result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber N. Pries was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment Plan Granted: $100/mo Starting on or before 04/01/2022
Follow payment plan or one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing, until paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber N. Pries

defendant.name: Pries, Amber N.
defendant.address: N6537 County Road K, Phillips, WI 54555

records.addlTxt:
10:10 AM Defendant Amber N. Pries appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts. Defendant is asked to take a seat in the back until finished with Initial appearances. Off record at 10:12 AM. Back on record at 10:26 AM appearances as previously stated. Court questions defendant on proceeding with her plea of NO CONTEST. Defendant states she would like to proceed. Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.   Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives right to attorney. Court accepts the waiver.  Defendant changes her plea and enters plea of GUILTY to the sole count in this matter.   Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties.
Court Imposes:
$300 Fine 
$200 DNA + Sample 

Payment plan granted: $100/mo Starting on or before 04/01/2022 and like payments every month after or one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing, until paid in full.

Appeal Rights Given
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
